title: Justin Hunter's contract with Steelers revealed - 247Sports
text:
Justin Hunter's contract with Steelers revealed Justin Hunter signed a very team friendly deal to become a member of the Pittsburgh Steelers. Slot to Pittsburgh Steelers Newsletter Newsletter 
Justin Hunter signed a very team friendly contract to become a member of the Pittsburgh Steelers for the 2017 season. 
According to NFL reporter Aaron Wilson, Hunter's one-year deal is worth $855,000 that includes a $30,000 signing bonus and a $50,000 roster bonus. 
The 6'4, 196-pound wideout was the second round pick in the 2013 NFL Draft after a breakout 2012 season with the Tennessee Volunteers, catching 73 passes for 1,083 yards and nine touchdowns during his final collegiate season. 
Love the Pittsburgh Steelers? Then what are you waiting for? Stay in the loop and sign up for our FREE Steelers newsletter! 
After three underwhelming seasons in Tennessee, Hunter played with both Buffalo and Miami last season. Four of his 10 receptions last season went for touchdowns, as Hunter comes to Pittsburgh with 78 career catches for 1,305 yards and 12 touchdowns. 
While Antonio Brown , Martavis Bryant (assuming the NFL reinstates him for the 2017 season), Eli Rogers , Sammie Coates and Darrius Heyward-Bey entering OTA's as the team's top-five receivers, Hunter will compete with Cobi Hamilton and Demarcus Ayers for a spot on Pittsburgh's active roster entering the 2017 regular season.
